intro: Boottia esquirolii, commonly known as the Esquiroli's boottia, is a rare and specialized plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Boottia esquirolii is considered a vulnerable species.
